data.title: Self Led Full Day Visits: Autumn Term (2024)
data.meta_description: “Overall it was a fabulous learning experience for the children and we will definitely be booking again.” St Luke’s CofE Primary School, Longsight “Thank you so much for the easy to follow timetables and maps." St Margaret’s Primary School, Whalley Range   Bring your class for a free, full day visit to the museum! data.text:
“Overall it was a fabulous learning experience for the children and we will definitely be booking again.” St Luke’s CofE Primary School, Longsight

“Thank you so much for the easy to follow timetables and maps." St Margaret’s Primary School, Whalley Range

Bring your class for a free, full day visit to the museum!

To ensure that all school groups are able to make the most of their museum visit, we require all school groups to book in with us and follow a specified timetable.

We have three different timetables available, each tailored to give you time to explore a range of galleries throughout the day.

Ancient Egypt & Archaeology A:

Arrive 10am / Depart 2pm:

10.10 - 11.00 Human History Zone (Archaeology, Egypt & Sudan, Collections Reimagined)

11.00 - 12.00 Wild Exhibition

12.00 - 12.30 Natural World Zone (Living Worlds, Natures Library, Vivarium)

12.30 - 13.00 Lunch in the Picnic Area

13.00 - 13.30 We Belong Zone (Belonging, Chinese Culture Gallery, South Asia Gallery)

13.30 - 14 :00 Fossils Zone (Dinosaurs, Fossils)

Ancient Egypt & Archaeology B (limited availability):

Arrive 10am / Depart 2pm:

10.10 - 11.00 Wild Exhibition

11.00 - 11.30 We Belong Zone (Belonging, Chinese Culture Gallery, South Asia Gallery)

11.30 - 12.00 Lunch in the Picnic Area

12.00 -13.00 Human History Zone (Archaeology, Egypt & Sudan, Collections Reimagined)

13.00 - 13.30 Fossils Zone (Dinosaurs, Fossils)

13.30 - 14.00 Natural World Zone (Living Worlds, Natures Library, Vivarium)

Science Focus:

Arrive 10am / Depart 2pm:

10.10 - 11.00 Fossils Zone (Dinosaurs, Fossils)

11.00 - 12.00 Natural World Zone (Living Worlds, Natures Library, Vivarium)

12.00 - 12.30 Lunch in the Picnic Area

12.30 - 13.30 Wild Exhibition

13.30 - 14 :00 Human History Zone (Archaeology, Egypt & Sudan, Collections Reimagined) / Belong Zone (Belonging, Chinese Culture Gallery, South Asia Gallery)

Why not bring your topic to life by adding a Big Question package to your booking?

Explore topics such as Ancient Egypt, Dinosaurs and Natural History through pre-visit videos and activities, a resource bag to borrow while you’re at the museum, and a post-visit interactive livestreamed event featuring digital object handling with our curators and learning team.

The package is designed to empower students to ask questions, develop their ideas, use evidence and be excited about museum collections – without the cost.

Just let us know you’d like to be part of this free package during the booking process. You can book activities and resources only, or choose a livestream date as well.
